name: Cage
The
Elephant
and
Garbage
lead
new
additions
to
Isle
of
Wight
Festival
content: The festival will take place later this summer from June 13-16Cage The Elephant and Garbage are among the new additions to the line-up for this year’s Isle of Wight Festival.This year’s festival will take place from June 13-16, with Noel Gallagher’s High Flying Birds, George Ezra and Biffy Clyro headlining.The likes of Cage The Elephant and Garbage have today (March 29) been confirmed as performers at the 2019 festival, with both bands set to play on the Big Top stage on the Saturday (June 15).Keane, Dermot Kennedy, Picture This, Ward Thomas, Wet Wet Wet, Björn Again, Feet and The Marcus King Band complete the new additions to the bill – you can see the updated line-up poster for the Isle of Wight Festival 2019 below.You can find out more information about this year’s festival, including ticket details, here.Cage The Elephant, meanwhile, released their Beck collaboration ‘Night Running’ yesterday (March 28). The track is taken from the band’s upcoming album ‘Social Cues’.Frontman Matt Shultz spoke to NME about ‘Night Running’ last month, explaining: “We’d found a really great direction for the chorus but it was one of those songs where I was just stumped on the directions for the verses. We were talking about how to finish the song and Brad [Shultz, guitarist] was like, ‘For some reason, I feel like Beck would know.'”Garbage have added this new festival performance to an already stacked summer 2019 touring schedule, which will continue on these shores in Cambridge after their slot at the Isle of Wight Festival.
